etymology.description: Depicts rotation (originally a spiral) -> concept of returning or turning back
etymology.interpretation: The character 回(回) (huí, "return") visually represents a circular motion or spiral, symbolizing the action of returning or coming back.

examples.chinese: 我决定回家(我決定回家)。
他回头看了看(他回頭看了看)，确认找到了路(確認找到了路)。
examples.pinyin: Tā huítóu kàn le kàn, quèrèn zhǎodào le lù.
examples.english: He turned back to take a look, confirming that he found the way.

examples.chinese: 钟声响起时(鐘聲響起時)，她便回故乡了(她便回故鄉了)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngshēng xiǎngqǐ shí, tā biàn huí gùxiāng le.
examples.english: When the bell rang, she immediately returned to her hometown.
